solution_line_template: As each sale represents a customer, there must be a total of {sports_store_sales} sports store sales + {music_store_sales} music store sales = <<{sports_store_sales}+{music_store_sales}={total_customers}>>{total_customers} customers.

There is an equal number of customers in every car, so there must be {total_customers} total customers / {num_cars} cars = <<{total_customers}/{num_cars}={customers_per_car}>>{customers_per_car} customers in each car.
